Dating: BYZANTINE PERIOD (not before); COPTIC PERIOD ?; COPTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Fragment of  wedge shape
Description: New technology appeared in Egypt at the start of the Christian era. The looms became more complicated and the fabrics more complex. The wool "taquetÃ©s" with a checkerboard motif are the oldest examples of this advance in technology. As the development progressed, the decorations began to consist of meanders, octagons and birds. This example consists of a plain purple band and a piece of beige and brown wool made up of registers of flower motifs in a geometric network of meanders (compare ACO.Tx. 0060).
